body: Correct, this was a requested change. Please see #567 and #786; the former has a snippet to add the aliases back if you desire them. You can place that in your `~/powershell/profile.ps1`.
I should say that they don't actually take precedence (in fact, the aliases will take precedence); but it was because of this behavior that we removed them.

Hi
I have the same problem on Ubuntu 20.04 and Powershell 7.1. Is there any way to fix that? I see that the reporting date is for five years ago.
```
  15 |  …  | Select VM, IPAddress , @{N='Notes';E={$_.VM.Notes}} | Sort -Proper …
     |                                                             ~~~~
     | The term 'Sort' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable
     | program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is
     | correct and try again.

```
Some information are shown below

OK I followed the topics and the solution is to use `Sort-Object` instead of `Sort`.
